content: 1 of 12 conjoined sock twins by katherine richmond rinaradish this sock is an exercise in both toe up and top down sock knitting can a toe-up toe and heel be reversed to make a top-down sock that looks almost identical better yet can it be knit in one piece until the end this pair of socks is knit in one piece from the toe of the first up to the cuff a stitch is marked to cut later and then the second sock is knit down to the toe after grafting the second toe the socks are separated and a decorative bind off is used on both socks at the cuff supplies needed 70-100 g or 2 5-3 5 oz of good sock yarn solid or semi solid color is preferred as to not obscure the cable pattern the sample shown was knit for size eu 40/us 9 70 g/2 5 oz of west yorkshire spinners signature 4 ply 400 m/437 yds per 100 g for a size 64 <or> 75 g/2 6 oz of stunning string studio smashing sock 421 m/460 yds per100 g for a size 68 shown in photos 5 5 m/6 yds of a similar yarn but in a contrasting color conjoined sock twins v6 0 ©2025 katherine richmond rinaradish 2 of 12 1 removable stitch marker 4 regular stitch markers cable needle sock needles in the appropriate size for the foot of the sock i used 2 25 mm us size 1 double-pointed needles dpns one size up needles for the leg as the cable pattern does pull in some if needed one or two sizes smaller for separation of the legs at the end if desired gauge 34 stitches x 48 rounds in 10 cm/ 4 inches in stockinette using the foot size needles size 64 68 72 stitches consider the cables on the leg and with ribbing on the foot choose the larger size if you are between sizes and/or go up a needle size for the legs abbreviations k = knit p = purl k2tog = knit 2 stitches together p2tog = purl 2 stitches together ssk = slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 stitch knitwise slip both stitches back purl wise together then knit them through the back loop or alternatively slip one knit wise knit one pass slipped stitch over yo = yarn over bor = beginning of round mor = middle of round ds = double stitch for the german short row kyot = knit yo through back loop to twist closed kyort = remount the yo so that the leading leg is behind the needle then knit through the front loop pyot = purl the yo through the back loop pyort = remount the yo so that the leading leg is behind the needle and purl through the front loop tutorials judy s
